text: sheldon_cooper Well , this sandwich is an unmitigated disaster . I asked for turkey and roast beef with lettuce and swiss on wholewheat .
raj_koothrappali What did they give you ?

sheldon_cooper Turkey and roast beef with swiss and lettuce on wholewheat . It 's the right ingredients but in the wrong order . In a proper sandwich the cheese is adjacent to the bread to create a moisture barrier against the lettuce . They might as well have dragged this thing through a car wash .
leonard_hofstadter I do n't believe it .
sheldon_cooper I know , it 's basic culinary science .
leonard_hofstadter Some guy is auctioning off a miniature time machine prop from the original film and no - one is bidding on it .
howard_wolowitz A time machine from the movie The Time Machine ?
leonard_hofstadter No , a time machine from Sophie 's Choice .
raj_koothrappali Boy , Sophie could have used a time machine in that movie . Did you see it , it 's rough .
howard_wolowitz Oh , that 's cool .
leonard_hofstadter Uh - huh .
raj_koothrappali It 's only $ 800 ?
leonard_hofstadter Yeah . And that 's my bid .
sheldon_cooper You bid $ 800 .
leonard_hofstadter It was a spur of the moment thing , I figured it would go for thousands and I just wanted to be a part of it .
sheldon_cooper There 's only 30 seconds left in the auction .
howard_wolowitz Do you have $ 800 ?
leonard_hofstadter Not to blow on a miniature time machine .
howard_wolowitz Do n't worry , the way these things work there 's people waiting ' til the last second to bid , and then they swoop in and get it , it 's called sniping .
raj_koothrappali Fifteen seconds .
leonard_hofstadter Come on , snipers .
raj_koothrappali Ten , nine , eight ... .
leonard_hofstadter Where are your snipers ?
raj_koothrappali Five .
leonard_hofstadter Snipe .
raj_koothrappali Four .
leonard_hofstadter Snipe .
raj_koothrappali Three .
leonard_hofstadter Snipe !
raj_koothrappali Two .
leonard_hofstadter SNIPE !
raj_koothrappali One .
leonard_hofstadter Aaaa - aw !
raj_koothrappali Congratulations , you are the proud owner of a miniature time machine .
howard_wolowitz You lucky duck .
sheldon_cooper I wonder why no - one else bid , this is a classic piece of sci - fi movie memorabilia .
leonard_hofstadter Yeah , I know , I still ca n't afford it .
howard_wolowitz Why do n't we share it ? We 'll each put in two hundred bucks and we 'll take turns having it in our homes .
raj_koothrappali A time share time machine ? I 'm in . Sheldon ?
sheldon_cooper Need you ask ? But I still do n't understand why no - one else bid .
sheldon_cooper I understand why no - one else bid .
raj_koothrappali Did the listing actually say miniature ?
leonard_hofstadter I just assumed . Who sells a full sized time machine for $ 800 ?
sheldon_cooper In a venn diagram , that would be an individual located within the intersection of the sets ' no longer want my time machine ' and ' need $ 800 ' .
howard_wolowitz It 's actually a tremendous bargain , even with shipping it works out to less than four dollars a pound .
raj_koothrappali Cocktain shrimp are $ 12.50 .
leonard_hofstadter How are we going to get it upstairs ?
howard_wolowitz If we take the dish off it might fit in the elevator .
leonard_hofstadter Yes but the elevator 's been broken for two years .
sheldon_cooper I 've been meaning to ask you , do you think we should make a call about that ?

howard_wolowitz Not necessary , I have a masters in engineering , I remotely repair satellites on a regular basis . I troubleshoot space shuttle payloads . When the Mars rover started pulling to the left I performed a front end alignment from 62 million miles away . No , that baby 's broken .
leonard_hofstadter Come on , guys , push .
howard_wolowitz If I push any harder I 'm going to give birth to my colon .
raj_koothrappali I ca n't feel my fingers , hurry up .
sheldon_cooper It 's the same amount of work no matter how fast you go , basic physics .
raj_koothrappali Sheldon ?
sheldon_cooper Yeah .
raj_koothrappali If my fingers ever work again , I 've got a job for the middle one .
penny Oh , hey guys .
leonard_hofstadter Uh , hi Penny . Take a break , guys !
penny What are you doing ?
leonard_hofstadter Oh , just , you know , moving ... something upstairs .
penny What is it ?
leonard_hofstadter It 's ... you know , time machine .
penny Yeah , okay , neat , but I really got to get to work , so ... .
leonard_hofstadter Uh , just give us a few minutes .
penny I do n't have a few minutes , I 'm running really late .
sheldon_cooper Then I have a simple solution , go up to the roof , hop over to the next building , there 's a small gap , do n't look down if you 're subject to vertigo , and use their stairwell .
penny You 're joking , right ?
sheldon_cooper Oh , I never joke when it comes to vertigo .
penny Damn , okay , I 'll just take the roof .
leonard_hofstadter Hey , if you wait for us to set up the time machine , I can drop you off at work yesterday . Time travel joke , it 's not ... never mind .
sheldon_cooper For what it 's worth , I thought it was humorous .
leonard_hofstadter Let 's just do this . Guys , ready to push ?
raj_koothrappali In a minute . Howard stepped outside to throw up .
sheldon_cooper I do n't know what you were worried about . I think it really works in the room .
leonard_hofstadter Yeah . It is by far the coolest thing I have ever owned .

sheldon_cooper The exact time machine that carried actor Rod Taylor from Victorian England into the post - apocalyptic future , which society had splintered into two factions , the sub - terranean Morlocks , who survived by feasting on the flesh of the gentle surface dwelling Eloy .
howard_wolowitz Talk about your chick magnets .

raj_koothrappali Oh yeah . The guy who lives next to me is always like , I have a Jacuzzi on my balcony , I have a Jacuzzi on my balcony . But wait until I tell him , I 've got a time machine on my balcony . Stuff that in your speedos , Jacuzzi Bob !
sheldon_cooper Gentlemen , I know we said we 'd take turns , but I think you 'd agree that practicality dictates it remain here .
howard_wolowitz You ca n't just keep it here , what if I meet a girl and say , ' you wanna come up and see my time machine , it 's at my friends house , ' how lame is that ?
raj_koothrappali He 's got a point .

sheldon_cooper Alright , I think we 're going to need some ground rules , in addition to the expected no shoes in the time machine and no eating in the time machine , I propose that we add pants must be worn at all times in the time machine .
leonard_hofstadter Seconded .
howard_wolowitz I was going to put down a towel .
raj_koothrappali I still want it on my balcony . I say we move it on a bi - monthly basis .
leonard_hofstadter That sounds fair .
sheldon_cooper Hold on . Bi - monthly is an ambiguous term , do you mean move it every other month , or twice a month ?
raj_koothrappali Twice a month .
sheldon_cooper Then no .
raj_koothrappali Okay , every other month .
sheldon_cooper No .

leonard_hofstadter Sheldon , you ca n't be selfish , we all paid for it , so it belongs to all of us . Now out of the way so I can sit in my time machine . Okay , I am setting the dials for March 10th , 1876 .
howard_wolowitz Good choice , Alexander Graham Bell invents the telephone and calls out for Dr Watson .
sheldon_cooper Wait a minute , I 'd want to see that too .
leonard_hofstadter So , when it 's your turn you can .
sheldon_cooper But if we all go back to the same point in time , Bell 's lab is going to get very crowded , he 'll know something 's up .
raj_koothrappali Also , since the time machine does n't move in space , you 'll end up in 1876 Pasadena .

howard_wolowitz And even if you can make it to Boston , what are you going to do , knock on the door and say to Mrs Bell , ' hey Mrs Bell , big fan of your husband , can I come in and watch him invent the telephone ? '
raj_koothrappali Mrs Bell was deaf , she 's not even going to hear you knock .
sheldon_cooper Oh , I have a solution , first go into the future and obtain a cloaking device .
raj_koothrappali Ooh , how far into the future ?
sheldon_cooper If I remember correctly , Captain Kirk will steal a cloaking device from the Romulans on Stardate 5027.3 , which will be January 10th 2328 by pre - federation reckoning .
leonard_hofstadter Okay , I am setting the dials for January 10th , 2328 . Here we go into the future . That was fun .
raj_koothrappali My turn .
penny Okay , first of all , what you call a gap was nearly three feet wide , I slipped and skinned my knee .
leonard_hofstadter Are you okay ?

penny Zzz - zz - zz - zz ! Second of all , the door to the stairwell of the other building was locked , so I had to go down the fire escape which ends on the third floor , forcing me to crawl through the window of a lovely Armenian family , who insisted I stay for lunch .
leonard_hofstadter That does n't sound too bad .
penny It was eight courses of lamb , and they tried to fix me up with their son .
leonard_hofstadter Sorry .
penny Not done . By the time I finally got to work , they 'd given my shift away . Yeah , that 's right , I 've lost an entire day 's pay thanks to this ... . this ... .
sheldon_cooper Time machine .
leonard_hofstadter The lights flash and the dish spins , you wanna try it ?
penny No ! I do n't want to try it , my God , you are grown men , how could you waste your lives with these stupid toys and costumes and comic books and ... . and now that ... . that ... .
sheldon_cooper Again , time machine .
penny Oh please , it 's not a time machine , if anything it looks like something Elton John would drive through the Everglades .
sheldon_cooper It only moves in time . It would be worse than useless in a swamp .
penny Pathetic . All of you , completely pathetic .
raj_koothrappali My turn !
sheldon_cooper Leonard , it 's two in the morning .
leonard_hofstadter So ?
sheldon_cooper So it 's my turn . Why did you set it for the day before yesterday ?
leonard_hofstadter Because I want to go back and keep myself from getting a time machine .

sheldon_cooper You ca n't . If you were to prevent yourself from buying it in the past , you would not have it available in the present to travel back and stop yourself from buying it , ergo you would still have it . This is a classic rookie time travel mistake .
leonard_hofstadter Can I go back and prevent you from explaining that to me ?

sheldon_cooper Same paradox . If you were to travel back in time and , say , knock me unconscious , you would not then have the conversation that irritated you , motivating you to go back and knock me unconscious .
leonard_hofstadter What if I knocked you unconscious right now ?
sheldon_cooper It wo n't change the past .
leonard_hofstadter But it would make the present so much nicer .
sheldon_cooper Are you upset about something ?
leonard_hofstadter What was your first clue ?
sheldon_cooper Well , it was a number of things . First the late hour , then your demeanour seems very low energy , plus your irritability ... .
leonard_hofstadter Yes I 'm upset .
sheldon_cooper Oh ! I do n't usually pick up on those things . Good for me .
leonard_hofstadter Yeah , good for you .
sheldon_cooper Oh , wait . Did you want to talk about what 's bothering you ?
leonard_hofstadter I do n't know . Maybe .
sheldon_cooper Wow , I 'm on fire tonight .
leonard_hofstadter Uh , here 's the thing . Girls like Penny never end up with guys who own time machines .
sheldon_cooper I disagree . Your inability to successfully woo Penny long predates your acquisition of the time machine . That failure clearly stands on its own .
leonard_hofstadter Thanks for pointing it out .

sheldon_cooper In addition , your premise is flawed . In the original film , Rod Taylor got Yvette Mimeaux with that very time machine . In Back to the Future , Marty McFly got the opportunity to hook up with his extremely attractive young mother .
leonard_hofstadter Those are movies .
sheldon_cooper Well of course they 're movies . Were you expecting me to come up with an example involving a real life time machine ? That 's absurd .
leonard_hofstadter Come on , guys , push .
howard_wolowitz If I push any harder I 'm going to give birth to my colon .
penny Oh , hey guys .
leonard_hofstadter Uh , hi Penny . Take a break , guys !
penny What are you doing ?
leonard_hofstadter Oh , just , you know , moving a ... time machine .
penny Yeah , okay , neat , but I really got to get to work , so ... .
leonard_hofstadter No problem . Hang on .
penny But , what about your time machine .
leonard_hofstadter Some things are more important than toys .
penny Oh , I 'm scared .
leonard_hofstadter Do n't worry baby , I 've got you .
penny Oh , Leonard .
sheldon_cooper It 's still my turn .
sheldon_cooper What are you doing ?
leonard_hofstadter I 'm packing up all my collectibles and taking them down to the comic book store to sell .
sheldon_cooper Well is that really necessary . If you need money you can always sell blood . And semen .
leonard_hofstadter It 's not about money .
raj_koothrappali We brought food .
howard_wolowitz Lox and bagels , the breakfast of time travellers .
leonard_hofstadter Terrific , does anyone want to buy my share of the time machine ?
raj_koothrappali Why ?
leonard_hofstadter Because I do n't want it any more .
howard_wolowitz Why ?
leonard_hofstadter Just ... personal reasons .
sheldon_cooper My spidey - sense tells me this has something to do with Penny .
leonard_hofstadter Look , do you want to buy me out or not ?
raj_koothrappali I 'll give you a hundred dollars , which will make me half owner , and we 'll put it on my balcony .
howard_wolowitz Screw his balcony , I 'll give you a hundred and twenty and we 'll put it in my garage .
leonard_hofstadter I paid two hundred dollars for my share .
raj_koothrappali Dude , everyone knows a time machine loses half its value the minute you drive it off the lot .
sheldon_cooper I 'll go for two hundred , that time machine stays right where it is .
raj_koothrappali Three hundred , and I 'll throw in my original 1979 Mattel Millenium Falcon with real light speed sound effects .
leonard_hofstadter No , no more toys or action figures or props or replicas or costumes or robots or Darth Vader voice changers , I 'm getting rid of all of it .
howard_wolowitz You ca n't do that , look what you 've created here , it 's like nerdvana .
raj_koothrappali More importantly , you 've a Darth Vader voice changer ?
leonard_hofstadter Not for long .
raj_koothrappali Oh , I call dibs on the Golden Age Flash .
howard_wolowitz Hang on , I need that to complete my Justice Society of America collection .
raj_koothrappali Too bad , I called dibs .
howard_wolowitz Well you ca n't just call dibs .
raj_koothrappali I can and I did , look up dibs on Wikipedia .
sheldon_cooper Dibs does n't apply in a bidding war .
leonard_hofstadter It 's not a bidding war , I 'm selling it all to Larry down at the comic book store .
raj_koothrappali Why Larry ? Did Larry call dibs ?
howard_wolowitz Will you forget dibs !
leonard_hofstadter He offered me a fair price for the whole collection .
sheldon_cooper What 's the number , I 'll match it .
raj_koothrappali I 'll match it , plus a thousand rupees .
sheldon_cooper What 's the exchange rate .
raj_koothrappali None of your business . Take it or leave it .
howard_wolowitz Mom , my bar - mizvah bonds , how much do I got ? Thanks . I can go twenty six hundred dollars and two trees in Israel .
leonard_hofstadter Forget it guys , if I sell to one of you , the other two are going to be really mad at me .
sheldon_cooper Who cares , as long as you pick me .
raj_koothrappali Okay , Leonard , put down the box , let 's talk .
leonard_hofstadter Sorry Raj , my mind is made up .
sheldon_cooper No . I ca n't let you do this .
leonard_hofstadter Sheldon , get out of my way .
sheldon_cooper None shall pass .

leonard_hofstadter Okay . I did not want to do this but , I have here the rare mint condition production error Star Trek , The Next Generation Geordi LaForge , without his visor in the original packaging . If you do not get out of my way , I will open it .
howard_wolowitz Okay man , be cool , we 're all friends here .
penny What the hell 's going on ?
sheldon_cooper You hypocrite !
penny What ?

sheldon_cooper Little Miss ' grown ups do n't play with toys ' . If I were to go into that apartment right now , would I find Beanie Babies ? Are you not an accumulator of Care Bears and My Little Ponies ? And who is that Japanese feline I see frolicking on your shorts ? Hello , Hello Kitty !
penny Okay , okay look , if this is about yesterday , Leonard , I am really sorry about what I said , I was just a bit upset .
leonard_hofstadter No , I needed to hear it .
penny No you did n't . Look , you are a great guy , and it is things you love that make you who you are .
howard_wolowitz I guess that makes me large breasts .
leonard_hofstadter Still , I think it 's time for me to get rid of this stuff and ... you know ... move on with my life .
penny Really ?
leonard_hofstadter Yeah .
penny Oh . Wow . Good for you .
leonard_hofstadter Thanks . Hey , do you want to , I do n't know , later ... .

penny Hi Mike .
mike Are you ready to go .
penny Yeah , I just have to change .
mike I 'll give you a hand .
penny Oh , stop it ! Bye guys .
leonard_hofstadter My turn on the time machine .
sheldon_cooper It worked . It really worked . They said I was mad , but it worked . Oh no , not Morlocks ! Not flesh - eating Morlocks ! He - e - e - e - e - e - e - elp !
leonard_hofstadter Sheldon , are you okay ?
sheldon_cooper We have to get rid of the time machine .

sheldon_cooper Yeah , that 's the problem , it 's too big .
